author: nashatyrev
content:
Thinking about the following DAS ForkChoice case: 
- suppose we have late (unhappy) shard header confirmation case (when < 2/3 of committee attested a shard header) 
- suppose the shard header gets confirmed on epoch transition (say at slot `N`) due to majority of votes 
- suppose DAS sampling fails for that shard header for some reason 
Due to the current DAS ForkChoice spec no blocks at the slot `>= N` could be considered as a head anymore since 'new dependencies' for any block would include the `DataCommitment` with unavailable DAS sampling. The ForkChoice appears to be stuck. 
Am I missing anything here probably?
